communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all email correspondence between 1SG Stephen Bonina and any email address within the domain @warfighterhousing.com. This request includes all sent and received emails, attachments, and any other electronic communication from January 1, 2021, to the present.
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please ensure that the search includes any emails where  Stephen Bonina is either the sender or recipient, and the other party's email address ends with @warfighterhousing.com.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place to ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all email correspondence between 1SG Stephen Bonina and any email address within the domain @warfighterhousing.com. This request includes all sent and received emails, attachments, and any other electronic communication from January 1, 2021, to the present.
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please ensure that the search includes any emails where  Stephen Bonina is either the sender or recipient, and the other party's email address ends with @warfighterhousing.com.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place to ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

title: TDY Lodging SC (South Carolina Army National Guard)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All correspondence to and from Kennith Wingard from January 1, 2022 to the present that include any of the following keywords: "housing", "TDY", “Warfighter", "furniture", "lodging" "per diem" "DMC", "C2", "Kennith", Ken", "Clark", "KW", "CM”, “WF”
To facilitate your search for these records, please include any correspondence where Kennith Wingard is either the sender or recipient, and the specified keywords appear in the subject line, body, or attachments of the communications. This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please include any correspondence where Kennith Wingard is either the sender or recipient, and the specified keywords appear in the subject line, body, or attachments of the communications.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C
